snippet: The book “Where the Moon Isn’t” went by “The Shock of the Fall” in Britain, and its publisher is reintroducing it under the second title after it won an award.
abstract: Nathan Filer book Where the Moon Isn’t is being reintroduced in United States by its publisher St Martin's Press under its original title The Shock of the Fall; book's new publication follows its win of Costa Book Award, which honors books written by authors who live in Britain or Ireland.
lead_paragraph: The book “Where the Moon Isn’t” went by “The Shock of the Fall” in Britain, and its publisher is reintroducing it under the second title after it won an award.

headline.main: After Prize, Novel Gets 2nd Chance in the U.S.
headline.print_headline: After Prize, Novel Gets 2nd Chance in the U.S.
